website_summaries.verdict: These heavy weatherproof boots meet demands of tough weather conditions but they are not ideal for light to moderate hiking.
pros: The ideal match for poor weather conditions due to exceptional durability and a very rugged design that boasts excellent tread
cons: May feel too heavy on feet when worn for longer hikes

customer_reviews.title: FAKE- do not buy!
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY THESE BOOTS! They are FAKE. These boots retail for $115 of Timberland's website. Clearly selling them for $70 is already suspicious! The boots don't come in a Timberland's shoe box and doesn't have the same tags or brand markings like real ones do!
customer_reviews.author: HWeathers

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend going up half a size
customer_reviews.text: They look great and I can tell that they're excellent quality. However, after reading the reviews about these being true to size, I went ahead and ordered the usual size that I wear in other shoes, which is a 6.5, but I wish I would have ordered a half a size larger because my toe hits the boot very harshly. I ordered these boots for rigorous hiking and buying your usual size in shoes is not a good idea. I will be exchanging for a size 7 and I would recommend going up a half size in order to accommodate comfortable socks and have enough room for swollen feet after 10 mile hikes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I think these were used
customer_reviews.text: I have ordered these shoes many times (I have foot issues and these fit me correctly) and they have always come in good shape in a Timberland shoe box. This pair came in a bag, and were all scuffed up, and laces were opened. I didn't have any choice but to wear them as mine were ruined in an accident and I needed these immediately. VERY disappointed that I would pay the same for used shoes as new ones. Going to be looking elsewhere from now one
customer_reviews.author: Teri A Post

customer_reviews.title: one waterproof boot leaks
customer_reviews.text: these boots were supposed to be waterproof; the left boot is waterproof but the right boot leaks. I wore these boots in dry weather for about 7 days since I bought them; now that we have had snow, I have worn them shoveling snow and the right boots leaks and my foot is wet after about 20 minutes of shoveling the driveway.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne Weber

customer_reviews.title: Received pre-used boots
customer_reviews.text: I received these in an unmarked shoe box with animal hair and snags on both boots. Not what I thought when buying new boots. I didn’t bother trying them on so I can’t say how the fit was.
customer_reviews.author: Candice

customer_reviews.title: Love these boots!
customer_reviews.text: Best all around boots you can buy. Take care of them and they last a very long time. Size 9 fits me perfect. Don't pay attention to people that say they scuff easily. It's the nature of the beast. People that whine about this are new to the brand. Long time users know a scuff here and there just means you're active. These are NOT like dress shoes. These are waterpoof boots you can either hike around with or wear to the store. Perfect jeans shoes! Just buy these great boots!
customer_reviews.author: Diane

customer_reviews.title: NOT COMFORTABLE AT ALL
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had returned these. I was hoping that After a few wears, they would be more comfortable. They rub my ankles from front to back and are stiff. They seem off balance and don’t bend in the right places and are not up to Timberland’s standards in my estimation as far as the actual cut of the boot. The materials seem ok though. I am very disappointed in TIMBERLAND. I have worn TIMBERLANDS for numerous years and have had at least twenty pair, but now I will think twice about buying them.
customer_reviews.author: Fleurette Pierre

customer_reviews.title: High quality & comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: I usually wear a sz 7, but I did go up a 1/2 size after reading reviews, because I want to wear these with thicker socks. They fit perfectly and after wearing them all day, found them to be very comfortable. I have an extremely high arch so I can loosen the laces to take care of that issue, while pulling the upper laces tighter. These are very well made & I really like the Timberland brand as it speaks to the high quality of their products. They don't have a good arch support, but that can be taken care of with an insert without any problems at all. Highly recommend these work boots!
customer_reviews.author: junipers

customer_reviews.title: A Little Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: These boots seem to be good quality but I am disappointed in the fit. For a wide width they fit too snug in the toe box. Also my toes are almost to the toe end. I am wondering if they will loosen up a little after wearing a few times. I ordered my usual size. I can't order an extra wide because the heel area would be too loose. I have ordered shoes recently in the same size and both pairs were almost too roomy - boots are different of course but if I keep these I can only wear lightweight socks with them.
customer_reviews.author: kathie

customer_reviews.title: Sent regular, not wide--despite what the box says.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a pair of 8W boots, which is what the box said. I noticed they still felt a little narrow so I checked the tongue tag, and sure enough they're regular 8's. They probably would've worked for me if they were just a little bit wider, so it's a shame they sent me boots that didn't match the box. How or why that happened I'll never know, but you can bet the next person that orders 8W will probably get this pair anyway. Which is why I will not bother reordering. It's a bummer--they're really beautiful boots.
customer_reviews.author: ADK

customer_reviews.title: "Uncomfortable everywhere"
customer_reviews.text: Boots arrived on time with prime: love the fast delivery. The boots had no padding for your feet and the high back rubbed up against my heal: very uncomfortable. I am a size 10 and have ordered other shoe/sneaker items thru amazon that fit perfectly. These boots were very uncomfortable, it took 2 minutes to decide they were being returned. The reason for two stars was the color: the buck stops there!!!!;
customer_reviews.author: G24ever

customer_reviews.title: Speedy shipment
customer_reviews.text: Wore these shoes on my first plane flight and was stopped by security and had to have every part of me checked by 2 security ladies all because the boots had a trace of a suspected substance! Good grief!!! I'm a grandma and vegan and about as clean of a person as you could get! What a horrid experience but thankfully we did have a good laugh at the end of it! What are you all doing in the warehouse there??
customer_reviews.author: Dia

customer_reviews.title: Great boots
customer_reviews.text: Love these boots. I did a lot of research and read reviews and went with these Timberlands and I am so glad I did! I have only worn these out and about so far but anticipate that they will be great hiking. They are comfortable and feel very quality. The design also helps with balance and I feel solidly planted on the ground. I have MS so that is exciting. I did oil them before wearing after reading the other reviews on them scuffing easily. Now that they are oiled, whenever I see a scuff, I just rub it and it's back to good.
customer_reviews.author: A Brown

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: I wear 71/2 - bought 8 and still too small. I bought wide width and my toe hits- very uncofortable
customer_reviews.author: joy

customer_reviews.title: I love these boots!
customer_reviews.text: I do my 10,000 steps most days, either through wet grass, gravel, mud, asphalt or rough woodsy areas. I have over probation and arthritis and exercise is the best medicine. I studied many boots to find leather, waterproof, good traction, and most of all comfy with good arch support. I love these boots and feel I made the best choice. I absolutely love these boots. Fashion was not really an issue but have to admit I was thrilled when a couple of weeks after my purchase I saw a news articles about two high profile ladies that were wearing Timberland boots. One was the beautiful Melania Trump our First Lady and the other one somebody named Commala.
customer_reviews.author: Book Nerd Mom5

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: OMG. THESE.BOOTS. I am active outside and have purchased 100's of pairs of boots over the years. These are amazing. By far THE BEST I have ever bought. There are wide widths available, so I was acutally able to purchase my true size. When I put them on, they were like wearing an old pair of the most comfortable boots that I ahve had forever. I have worn them hiking, and just as a daily wear. I did get one blister, or even red mark. They fit THAT PERFECT. Thank you so much! I am thinking of ordering a second pair just incase Timberland discontinues these and I need another pair later down the road. I highly recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: VERY NICE BOOT & comfortable too
customer_reviews.text: A very nice boot. I just had a right knee replacement in August and am getting the left done in a few days so I wanted to get a new boot for the winter and something that would grip the terrain wherever I walk. This fits my needs perfect. The price is right. And the boot fits great. Better than a $200 pair I bought before. I’ve had boots from this brand before and have never had a problem. You may need to use an additional arch support depending on your foot. I’m not using one yet but I’m sure as the boot wears down I will need one before the boots life runs out.
customer_reviews.author: Sharron kelly

customer_reviews.title: Best hiking boot ever for wide feet
customer_reviews.text: No break in time! I have wide feet which are difficult to fit. I wear a 7 wide but I bought a 7.5 wide and hoped that I could wear them with thick merino WoolX socks. It’s a miracle! Perfect fit with the thick socks. I hope Timberland never stops making these. I just got back from roaming around the Scottish Highlands and Islands, and these boots were wonderful through rain and puddles and on slippery ground. I also discovered that I can leave them without their laces tied and easily walk, step in, and out of them at airport security lines. Love these boots even more!
customer_reviews.author: Rio  Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Seemed okay, but quality doesn't seem up to par
customer_reviews.text: I recommend sizing up a half size if your feet are average to wide. If your feet are wide then maybe a full size up. The toe box was very narrow and tight. I wanted a supportive shoe/boot for hikes but this was way too stiff. Although the quality seemed okay there were some features on the shoe that seemed like it was not as great quality as this brand is typically known for. The fact that the shoes are now made in China was a big disappointment. The lack of stitching and the overall feel. The shoes still say waterproof but I was skeptical.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: My old ones were easy to shine and were great for hiking
customer_reviews.text: I had a pair of these I wore for years, but they have changed the type of leather they are made of. My old ones were easy to shine and were great for hiking, for snow and everyday use and did not leak for years. These leaked with the first puddle I stepped in and I returned them.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Andrus

customer_reviews.title: 5 years in, still going strong
customer_reviews.text: I bought these in June 2015 and I still love them. I think the look is nice and classic, and they've lasted me through many hikes and music festivals as well. To be fair, I'm not using them regularly (maybe 10-20 days a year?) but have still lasted nicely for how much I batter them around when I do use them. Keep my feet dry, ankles protected, good traction on slippery ground. Sometimes after many hours of wear my heels start to hurt, but I don't think that's a fault of the shoe so much as being on my feet for a long time. Also - good value!
customer_reviews.author: CC

customer_reviews.title: Nice, comfy, sturdy, boot!
customer_reviews.text: Love the quality of this boot. It is a bit bulkier than I scorched, but still mostly comfortable. The first few days of wearing, I had ankle pain... pretty bad, where I had to kill a little. I’m not sure why, but it’s a very tight ankle fit. Laces have to be snug or blisters would be a concern for loose fit, movement, and rubbing. That has subsided after wearing several more times. They are comfortable and no more ankle pain. It could very well be just because my feet were not used to a higher ankle boot. All seems to be good now :)
customer_reviews.author: kathy g

customer_reviews.title: Great ankle support, very comfortable boots.
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are great. I bought these for a hike my old hiking boots didn't have ankle support and I twisted my ankle a couple months ago so I bought these because of the support. Great support nice cushioning. The shoes really didn't need breaking in because they already fit well and they're not stiff at all. They came in a brand new timberland box with all the tissue inserts and everything. I'm saying that because some people stated those were in our mark boxes or looked used, but mine were perfect. great purchase and I expect them to last a while.
customer_reviews.author: SLT

customer_reviews.title: Extremely comfortable right out of the box
customer_reviews.text: I bought these boots for my wife who likes to do yard work. They were a birthday present. I used her old Brooks Adrenaline GTS shoe for size knowing that I would probably have to exchange them. But, she loved them, loved the fit, and said they made her feet and legs tingle. She wore them around the house for an hour before finally taking them off and putting on the new Brooks Adrenaline GTS 20 shoes I also bought her for her birthday. I can't speak for the comfort of the shoe, but my wife was extremely pleased. I took a chance and it paid off. Yay, me!
customer_reviews.author: Fishman

customer_reviews.title: Excellent boots; low price.
customer_reviews.text: I read reviews for all different brands of waterproof hiking boots. I am a preschool teacher and out on the playground in rain and snow; I wanted a boot that would keep my feet warm and dry but wouldn’t be too hot to wear inside. These boots are perfect for this! I looked specifically for hiking boots because I love walking; I’d like to be a hiker in the future. I’ve walked through snowy cemeteries, woods, and all over town doing errands in these and they are very comfortable. And the price was great!
customer_reviews.author: Tanya Goff Davis

customer_reviews.title: Fake
customer_reviews.text: The boots arrived in a Timberland box but missing any tags. They are poorly stitched with crooked and rough seams. The shoe tounge is wrong and too narrow, and the eyelets are cut all the way . Also, some simbols and logos are missing in comparison with the sale photos. The boots don't look like real branded and waterproof. All in all, the boots I received do not match the photos and description on the website.
customer_reviews.author: Rosalia

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for outdoor work
customer_reviews.text: I use this forworking outdoors. They are perfect for quick put on with the wide opening and my feet are kept comfortable and dry. A bit plus is the support they give my ankles as I walk over unstable ground. I can easily get my footing even if I am carrying a load. I'm comfortable climbing on machinery or over a fence. The well formed sole sits well and doesn't slip. And when I come inside for a break they are an easy slip off with the laces quickly undone on the top hooks so I don't worry about tracking in dirt. Love these work shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Marrette Chambers

customer_reviews.title: I ordered the 10 and it's a good fit, a bit loose but I can wear ...
customer_reviews.text: Usually a 9 with a wide width, I ordered the 10 and it's a good fit, a bit loose but I can wear thick socks as a result. They are waterproof and snowproof. I snowshoed in them for a couple days straight. While they aren't crazy good at keeping feet warm, they sure as heck kept them dry. I went through a steam at one point, still dry. Love them. Also, I think they're cute.
customer_reviews.author: Zee

customer_reviews.title: Great overall boot
customer_reviews.text: I bought these books in 11/2019 and am writing a review 6/2020. So far these boots have held up very well, aside from scratching from normal wear. When I first received the boots, I wore them around the house for a bit to try to break them in but they were comfortable from the beginning. The only issue is ankle socks are a must so it doesn't rub. I've now worn these several times for hiking, camping, canoeing, and just walking around and theyve stayed waterproof and comfortable. On occasion the laces will come undone because they are still slippery and new, but overall i recommend these boots!
customer_reviews.author: Claire Kuettner

customer_reviews.title: Great boot, great price!
customer_reviews.text: These are perfect for those of us with short and wide feet, and they’re comfortable right out of the box. As in any ankle boot, the cuff is stiff at first, but it’s forming to fit better the more I wear them. I’ll definitely buy these again! Update: I ordered a half size up for hiking rough terrain, and kept the original boot for a work boots. It may not stand up to severe hiking conditions, but for my needs they suit me. At the price and quality, I'll stick with this boot.
customer_reviews.author: Gail Epps

customer_reviews.title: Really Like These Boots
customer_reviews.text: I have wide feet so was hesitant to order. Glad I did; I ordered my regular size 7, wide width, and the fit out of the box was almost perfect. I took a few days to wear them around the house, but also to lightly stretch the toe box, and now they are perfect. I could have skipped the stretching and just let the boots break in naturally. They are a really good looking boot, and my first hike in them was extremely comfortable. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: blueskies

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable right out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Based on other reviews, I was concerned about the width of this boot. Over the years, my feet have changed and now the ball of my foot hurts if a shoe is too tight. I debated between regular and wide width, and finally went with regular, since that is what I've always worn, and I am very happy with the room in the boot. A wide would have been way too sloppy. Even the regular width seems a bit loose if I am not wearing thick socks. I have always been a true size 8, and these fit perfectly, even after adding arch support insoles. They were soft and felt broke in right out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Laura H

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for hiking, especially if you have larger toes
customer_reviews.text: We hike a lot, like, a lot, and I've always needed shoes with a larger toe box, so we went through quite a lot of shoes that would hurt and blister after a long day, but not these! They're very waterproof (literally I can go through streams no problem) and have a lot of support so steep slopes and boulders are no problem. They're not particularly heavy either, and have lasted me quite some time without getting destroyed!
customer_reviews.author: Zeke

customer_reviews.title: Great boot
customer_reviews.text: I got a pair of these a year ago to replace some worn out Timberlands that served me well over the years. I loved mine so when my wife mentioned she needed new hiking boots I knew what to try for her. She really liked them and was impressed I picked out a good looking and great featured boot. We get to go to spring a fall soccer games on wet, cold fields and she said these will work out great there too since they are waterproof. Great boot. I love mine and I know she will love them the more she uses them as well.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: I got the wrong size....  :-(
customer_reviews.text: I debated for several days about these boots, comparing them with 2 other brands, then decided to go for it. Unfortunately, some recommended going a half-size up, which I did. When they arrived, I did a quick try-on, then went straight to sealing them with waterproofer. But they are really too big( width and length)...I should have gone with my normal size 8. So, my bad...anyone interested in a size 8 1/2, let me know, They are nice-looking boots, just the right height and not real heavy.
customer_reviews.author: cp32

customer_reviews.title: Good quality leather in a comfortable no break in hiking or walking boot!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent buy. Great quality leather. Small scuffs but boots look new (maybe returned after trying on) but don't look worn at all. The scuffs will blend in with wear like any natural distressed leather look. I'm between sizes so I ordered 1/2 size bigger. Wore those on 4 mile hike with no sore spots at all. I like the retro, chunky look. Nice treads for wet, slippery sidewalks or uneven trails. Very happy!
customer_reviews.author: Sandy

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy but light
customer_reviews.text: I’m a true 7.5 in flats and sandals, but like to wear hiking or sport socks with boots, so I always buy Sz 8 boots. These are roomy in the toe box, but fits just right with my hiking socks. There’s a little wiggle room, but I don’t want to worry about foot swelling and feeling constricted after long wear. Boots are lighter than expected, and it’s a pleasant surprise. Great value
customer_reviews.author: WS

customer_reviews.title: Great boot!
customer_reviews.text: I generally wear a 6.5 and that's what I ordered. These fit great and are very very comfortable. I've been hiking through mountains, streams, caves, and even have done some yard work wearing these, so they've been through a little water and everything else. They have held up beautifully. The soles have great traction. They're light-weight, and not too hot. I'll buy these again.
customer_reviews.author: Kirk

customer_reviews.title: Best hiking shoe out of 10 I’ve tried!!—- great shoes
customer_reviews.text: January 2018: These hiking shoes are perfect! No blisters after many 5 hour hikes in the snow. Kept my feet toasty (with wool socks)...Didn’t rub on my heal like other hiking shoes did. Great ankle support. Great waterproofing. And no weird creasing where the shoe bends a little. Overall awesome!!! Update August 2019: I have worn these shoes probably over 500 miles of hiking, mowing at my all day mowing job, hedge trimming, through the rain, through the dirt...and they still are holding up great!! I am definitely buying these again once these shoes need to be retired. I’m very impressed with these hiking shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best boots I ever owne
customer_reviews.text: These boots are the most comfortable boots I have ever owned and I am 89 years old. You put them on and go, no breaking in, no discomfort. I used them for working around my lawn and outbuildings. The only complaint I could have is that I generally wear a narrow shoe, and these do not come in N, so a little wide. Heavy socks solve the problem. The leather is soft and flexible along with being good quality and sturdy. The soles protect your feet from rocks ,etc. Just plain good quality boots for a
customer_reviews.author: shirley r.

customer_reviews.title: Maybe buy a half size up
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable. They give excellent traction and feel like they’ll hold up forever. I bought 1/2 size up and they fit perfectly. So my regular size would never have fit right. There isn’t extra room for super heavy socks or anything like that. My only complaint is that they’re not....pretty at all! They’re just not. But I was going for traction and durability and I definitely got that.
customer_reviews.author: L875

customer_reviews.title: Used regularly for almost 4 years
customer_reviews.text: These are amazing boots. I ended up paying $50 for them, but I would pay $200+ easily. I've been using them almost 4 years now, they've been on countless hiking and camping trips, not to mention 2 seasons of field work. Finally, this past weekend, the soles were worn down enough that it's time for a replacement. I got way more than my money's worth, and I will be repurchasing this same pair.
customer_reviews.author: kclareq

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: These boots are terrific! They fit my custom orthotics very well and I'm able to walk miles through a ski resort we visit frequently. Up and down the ski hill, through trails and the village itself. My feet stay warm and I get the support I need. (I have terrible feet). Plus, they are pretty darn cute. I wear the little "leggings" over my ankles for warmth and some style too :-) I needed the wide and they work great.
customer_reviews.author: SeattleSun

customer_reviews.title: The boots are comfortable, very sturdy and repels water
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves these boots! She is a Project Manager for a construction company. The boots are comfortable, very sturdy and repels water. We live in Houston. She is going into homes that have been damaged by Hurricane Harvey. I don't know how that girl can walk through all of the debris and waste! These boots have done a great job!
customer_reviews.author: Blackbird Going Home

customer_reviews.title: Lovely boot terrible insoles
customer_reviews.text: I must say that these boots are nice. I love that they're real leather and they look sooo much nicer than most other hiking boots. These however have the worst insoles ever. They are so flat that it doesn't even make a difference while they're in the shoe. I don't even have flat feet but these are really sad. I'd recommend buying some online to replace the ones they come with.
customer_reviews.author: Melody Hartman

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Hiking Boot
customer_reviews.text: Bought these specifically for a trip to Lake Harmony PA. We went on several hikes that consisted of very rocky, uneven paths. These held up great! They provide ample support for the ankles without being too tight or painful. Also kept my feet plenty warm in 30 degree weather with normal socks. I look forward to wearing these in the snow. I normally wear a 6-6.5 shoe and purchased the size 6.5. Fit was perfect with a little wiggle room in the toe area. (good for my bunion)
customer_reviews.author: bevasnaps

customer_reviews.title: Material on tongue falls off
customer_reviews.text: The boots themselves are comfy and, if you get the wide width because that's what you want, nice and wide. But, they have a defect: the material coating the tongue of the boot starts peeling off almost immediately. I wore them twice and pieces of it just kept falling off. I returned them.
customer_reviews.author: hacha

customer_reviews.title: Not for walking distance, not well made
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for a hiking trip I'm Scotland. Wore them around the house, but didn't realize until I was actually walking distance in these that they were so uncomfortable. The metal form in the heel/ankle was extremely painful, and made it impossible to continue wearing. I ended up having to purchase new shoes, and because my trip extended beyond the return policy for these, am stuck with these boots. I havery had Timberland in the past that I lived in they were so comfortable and wellmade. These boots are not.
customer_reviews.author: BETH A DOUBLE

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic boots!
customer_reviews.text: Needed some new hiking boots with an upcoming trip to Utah and arizona planned. Luckily got to try these out on a kayaking/camping trip before hand, and I can’t say enough good things. I usually wear an 8/8.5 and I decided to go with an 8. Even with thick wool socks, they fit perfectly. I wore these for 3 days straight because they were the only shoes I brought with me, and not 1 blister or bit of discomfort. They protected my feet from branches when searching for fire wood and the kept me feet dry while launching out kayak. Plus I think they’re super cute!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Scale of boot and crease lines
customer_reviews.text: My feet are 10.5, but there's no half sizes, so I ordered up to an 11. Some boots and shoes don't scale up well, with designers assuming that everything is bigger just because it's longer. I have average feet, I think, but narrow heels. The problem with scaling up in these boots is that the toe box opens up with too much interior space. For me, the the space beginning at the bottom of the laces to the front was too high and wide, and the crease was awkward in how and where it spread across the foot. I'm not keeping the boots because of this, am not looking at Timberland anymore, and I have found some good alternative boots!
customer_reviews.author: LoreleiP

customer_reviews.title: Wide width works great for me!
customer_reviews.text: Great for wide foot. Many hiking boots do not come in a wide width for women. These boots are perfect for my 8 1/2 wide feet. I added an additional plantar fasciitis insole with excellent arch support, something I need. I still have enough room in the boot for a good pair of hiking socks, and my toes are very happy. I am absolutely thrilled with these boots.
customer_reviews.author: MSWTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Can be worn without a breaking in period!
customer_reviews.text: These boots fit great! I wore them in the house first because I was afraid they would rub my foot but they didn’t. I usually wear an 8 wide but I ordered an 8.5m and they fit perfectly and I was able to use my inserts in them as well! The laces don’t stay tied as well as I would like but they are long enough that I can tie a double knot. They did have a couple of scuff marks on them when I got them but not bad enough that I couldn’t live with it.
customer_reviews.author: S Voit

customer_reviews.title: Coming apart
customer_reviews.text: I love these boots and the fit is great. However... I haven't owned them very long and haven't worn them very much and they are already coming apart where the leather meets the sole. I work indoors and my job is not strenuous so I was expecting these to last. Waited years to find a pair of timberlands I liked and I'm pretty sad I spent the money on the brand.
customer_reviews.author: Sara Oloughlin

customer_reviews.title: Painful
customer_reviews.text: I wore these for a day to start breaking them in, but got shin splints. The leather scuffed very easily. Shipped them back.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny

customer_reviews.title: Don’t do it
customer_reviews.text: This shoe HURTS and I mean BAD. The biggest thing is that the padding in the ankle for “support” is so thick that it’s painful and that pain does not go away. The ankle area was tight and painful and the other areas of the shoe were subpar for the price. I switched to the Columbia brand and it was a HUGE difference, way more comfortable. Even though I’d heard good things about Timberland- I cannot recommend this as a good hiking shoe. :(
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn Trudeau

customer_reviews.title: Perfect hiking boots
customer_reviews.text: I went hiking and climbing mountains and camping with these boots, I was really impressed I climbed the mountains with these boots very comfortably, they adapted quickly to my feet, these boots are waterproof and warm, only one detail should change the laces since these they slide and unzip constantly, but everything else is fine, I usually use size 8.5 but I order a size 9 to be able to wear with thick socks they adapted very well to my feet
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: They feel great! I work on a poultry farm
customer_reviews.text: These boots are fabulous! I usually wear a 10W in shoes. I bought 10M in these and they fit perfectly. They did not hurt my feet at all during the first time that I wore them. They feel great! I work on a poultry farm, and I desperately need some boots that are not only comfortable with support, but I also need them to be waterproofed. We have been receiving a lot of rain, and my farm is a "big mud puddle". I have stepped in mud and water puddles, and these boots did not leak at all. I truly recommend these boots for comfort!
customer_reviews.author: Janie S.

customer_reviews.title: Best Shoe For Active Lifestyles
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely LOVE these shoes! It's been a long time since I've owned a pair of Timberland, and now I finally found exactly what I was looking for at a good price. The last pair I had lasted me about 10 years, so I'm expecting these to keep up with my very active lifestyle just as long. I normally put gel inserts in every pair of shoes I own, however, not even necessary with this pair. Lace them up to your preference, put them on and go! You will not be disappointed. Can be worn with boot cut jeans, skinny jeans, shorts and even casual slacks (for work such as healthcare, outdoor jobs, standing all day, etc.). Great traction and comfort.
customer_reviews.author: Daniella L.Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Wide width not really wide
customer_reviews.text: The boots look great and of good construction, however I would not say they are even close to wide. I ordered the wide width for my daughter as a gift and even taking them out of the box they looked narrow. The first thing I did was check the label thinking maybe they sent the wrong size. The shipment/shoe was what I ordered. I will be trying another brand that truly are wide.
customer_reviews.author: Peggy Strickler

customer_reviews.title: Favorite boots
customer_reviews.text: I love this boot. I wear it daily for work and ended up ditching my other hiking boots to wear these for hikes and camping trips as well, so I finally got another pair specifically for that. Photo shows the wear after owning these boots for 1.5 years and wearing them roughly 5 days a week versus a brand new boot. I did end up having to upgrade the insole, but that’s a matter of personal preference. They’re light and comfortable and make being on my feet all day bearable. Excited to break in the new pair!
customer_reviews.author: Hannah

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Travel...and everywhere else
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for a ten day trip to Ireland for some comfortable light hiking in all weather. I was thrilled with these puppies. As someone who always has aching arches and shins after a walk, I was shocked at how cozy I was after full days of walking through rocky hillsides and endless castle stairs. They fit perfectly (I'm size 7) and didn't feel clunky or look giant on my feet. They held up in rugged weather, kept me dry in unexpected puddles, and still went well with a pair of jeans out for a casual dinner. Now that I'm back in NYC I still wear them all of the time. I can't recommend these shoes enough!
customer_reviews.author: E White

customer_reviews.title: Wide width could be a bit wider.
customer_reviews.text: These boots replaced an old pair of timberland boots and seem just as good except the right boot, in spite of being a wide width is tight across my toes. My old boots which are 15-20 years old were not a wide width and were a perfect fit. I hate to have to hope the right boot will become more comfortable in time....I don’t see an alternative.
customer_reviews.author: j prine

customer_reviews.title: A gift for her and she likes them!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these in size 6.5W for my wife, who currently wears and loves her size 6.5W Merrell Moab 2 hikers (also purchased on Amazon). She has only worn the Timberlands around town so far, but she says that they are comfortable and I believe her. She has not been shy about returning items that I have purchased for her, if there are any problems at all. Note that she always wears mid-weight crew socks with both the Timberlands and with her Merrell's. I intend to update this review in a few weeks, once we start hiking again and she is able to provide additional feedback.
customer_reviews.author: R Dwyer

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality Timberlands
customer_reviews.text: Poor quality shoes, despite being more expensive than the men's version they are inferior quality, lack arch support, and are flimsy. Returned immediately; purchased Men's shoe in smaller size instead.
customer_reviews.author: J. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: I usually buy 1 size larger hiking shoes to compensate the socks thikness but based on reviews I bought the exact size and it fi
customer_reviews.text: Definitely worth the price. I usually buy 1 size larger hiking shoes to compensate the socks thikness but based on reviews I bought the exact size and it fits just fine. I have hiked couple of times (20 miles) with these and they are comfortable and fit well. I added Dr scholl's inserts for more padding but works without them as well. I am coming back to this review after 4 months as I have used it since. I have hiked at least 200 miles on these and love them! very comfortable and sturdy for rough trails. I am very happy with this purchase! :)
customer_reviews.author: coffee7

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic boot!!
customer_reviews.text: Love these boots!! I have had mine for about two months and they are fabulous! Perfect for hiking! I fact I can go sm much further now with the right shoe and support! Not sure why people were having a problem with the tongue of the shoe, mine is great and I pull them tight for ankle support. Get these! You will be glad you did!
customer_reviews.author: Urbanchicphotography

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome boots! My friend had a pair for 11 years that were still in good shape, so I decided to get a pair for my sister. They are truly waterproof, and not too heavy to wear comfortably. She loves them and wears them daily! A note on sizing: they seem to run just a bit short, so I ordered a half size larger and they were a perfect fit. You need to actually lace the boots up to be certain of the fit; it seems like lacing them pulls your foot into the exact place it needs to be. I’ll be ordering a pair for myself!
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: Order your normal size
customer_reviews.text: I read some reviews that stated ordering a 1/2 size smaller but in a wide width would be the same as ordering your full size in a medium width. Not true for me, I suggest ordering your normal size, if out of stock... dont go smaller and wide, they will be too small. Great boots, durable, high quality, very cute.
customer_reviews.author: Joeyjessyelicody

customer_reviews.title: comfortable
customer_reviews.text: For the price these are great boots. Surprisingly comfortable for short day hikes. I normally wear a 7 in street shoes, bought these in 7.5 and probably should have ordered an 8 so I could wear hiking socks. (I always wear an 8 in running sneakers) Overall good day hike boots for light hikers.
customer_reviews.author: STP

customer_reviews.title: Medium width felt more like a narrow
customer_reviews.text: This is the FIRST item I’ve ever returned to Amazon. I bought a pair of these hiking boots at a local shoe store. Absolutely loved them and needed another pair (as I wore my old ones out). The ones from the shoe store were 7.5 M - made in China. Perfect fit. So I decided to order a pair from Amazon - 7.5 M. However, these on Amazon were made in Cambodia. They fit more like a narrow. I couldn’t wear them and had to return them. I did reorder a pair of 7.5 W. They were much better.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Not nearly as narrow/small as some people have said
customer_reviews.text: If you have previously worn Timberlands, these actually run BIG by Timberland sizing. My other Timberland boots are all 8.5 but I needed an 8W in these. I have very, very wide feet but even with two pairs of thick hiking socks my feet slopped around in the 8.5. TImberlands normally stretch a lot so I had to return.
customer_reviews.author: KS

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be holding up well! Theyre very comfortable and I wear them sometimes in the rain. They seem fairly waterproof, especially around the bottom. They also kept my feet relatively warm. Traction on slippery ground isn’t as good as I’d like, I totally wiped out one day. Certainly better than some other shoes I own, but I was hoping they’d be very non-slip. Also theyre cute and I like wearing them around town too.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren F

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: I recently moved to Okinawa Japan and have been hiking, and I wanted some hiking boots. These boots look nice but they are horrible. Very uncomfortable and the sizing is way off. I wear a size 6.5 but assumed with thick hiking socks I should buy a 7. They are least 1-1.5 sizes bigger than a 7. They provide no foot support and actually make my ankles hurt. Do not waste your money, spend the extra and get some legit ones.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not wide enough unlike previously
customer_reviews.text: This is my third pair of these over the years and I've always gotten 8 wide and could wear think socks under. But this pair I couldn't. I returned them and ordered a pair of wide hi teks which brand I've worn before and they are considerably wider. They seemed like fine boots I just couldn't wear my thick winter socks in them.
customer_reviews.author: D. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Good Boot
customer_reviews.text: I work in a park and so am out hiking a ton. I needed a new pair of boots but didn't want to spend an arm and leg, and I found these on sale for a really great price. I typically wear an 8.5-9 in women's shoes, so I ordered a 9. They fit great while having room for a thick pair of wool socks. The leather scuffed quickly but doesn't look bad compared to some of my other hiking shoes. I have had them for a year now and hiked in them a ton and they have held up well. I would recommend these if they are on sale for a good price.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie Cooper

customer_reviews.title: These Boots Kick...
customer_reviews.text: 2nd pair purchased. First pair lasted 3yrs. They still function well they've just taken a cosmetic beating. These are my teenage daughter's daily year round kicks. She's pretty rough on her gear which is why I went with the Timberland brand to begin with. They haven't let her down yet. This boot has stood up to everything she's thrown at em' from winter and summer hiking, ice fishing and her high school hallways. Great all season boot (Midwest U.S.A.) that stands the test of time.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Boots!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of these boots. I wore out the first pair while hiking Central Oregon on all sorts of trails. Lava fields, dirt paths, the Pacific Crest Trail have all been easy hikes with these boots. I've even worn them on disaster response deployments in some horrific conditions and they've held up and made things easier for me. They're comfortable and waterproof. They're also easy to clean. I'll be using these boots as long as they are available to buy. The fit us also pretty accurate. A big item to remember is to wear them in a bit before taking off on hikes and stuff.
customer_reviews.author: DA Slade

customer_reviews.title: Keeps my feet dry and comfy
customer_reviews.text: These boots are super comfortable. I bought them to work an outdoor event where I'm on my feet all day. I've worn them on a few hikes as well. My feet are always dry and comfortable. I can't wear my sneakers all day without my knees and back hurting and I do not have that experience with these boots - so they have great support.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I ordered a half size bigger
customer_reviews.text: Revising my review to add that these boots cause chaffing. I wear long socks but it can get uncomfortable. I love the boots in every other way though. I'm usually a 9.5 in regular footwear, but I ordered a 9.5 and it was a tad small for hiking, my toes were crammed to the front of the boot when moving down hill, but the 10s are perfect. They leave enough space for my feet to move inside the boot without discomfort.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wanted to like them
customer_reviews.text: Cute, cute boot. I really wanted to like them and find them comfortable, but they just weren't for me. They felt much too stiff; I usually wear Merrell or Keen and thought I'd give these a try. I almost kept them for as casual shoes, but they just didn't feel right to me; the wide width still felt narrow thru the toe box. But they really LOOK good; but I have to go for comfort every time
customer_reviews.author: Kristine R.

customer_reviews.title: Boot tongue fabric peeled off!
customer_reviews.text: These are beautiful boots. I was so excited when I took them out of the box. The leather is super soft. I tried them on and noticed the fabric on top of the boot tongue was peeling. I looked and thought, ok, let me just take out these few pieces of peeled plastic/fabric. On closer inspection, I saw that the entire book tongue was peeling, flake by flake. I looked at the other boot and the same thing was happening there. I was very disappointed and exchanged them -- I hope the next pair isn't peeling, too! Also the shoe was larger than a normal size 6 so I ordered a 5.5. Fingers crossed.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: After weeks of shopping EUREKA!
customer_reviews.text: First. Timberland has never disappointed. Second. I spent weeks looking for a good boot, not only for work, but also for hiking around the mountains where I live. I'm particular about by boots, since my feet seem to be changing when getting older. These boots are comfortable and fit the bill.
customer_reviews.author: R. A. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Great quality! Very sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy and perfect fit! I'm a 7.5, I ordered a 7.5 and they are perfect. There is also some arch support which is nice and makes the shoe more comfortable. They are a little stuff (which is to be expected, they just arrived and I haven't broken them in yet). You can lace them all the way up for ankle support or half way to give more movability to your foot and ankle (I prefer the second way. They look exactly like the photo. Very happy with this purchase!!
customer_reviews.author: Genevieve N.

customer_reviews.title: Got them for Walking
customer_reviews.text: I have only worn them once so far but really like them. No breaking in or anything. I ordered 1/2 size up to be able to wear ski socks with my boots for walking. I walk about 4 miles at a time - up and down several hills. My feet felt fine when I finished walking with no hurting or blisters, etc. I would get these again.
customer_reviews.author: Raryl

customer_reviews.title: Great product delivered quickly, as represented
customer_reviews.text: I like my Timberland boots so much, I suggested she get a similar pair. Great ankle support for hiking similar-rough terrain and crossing small creeks. I purchased the pair for her after looking at the Amazon online ratings for hiking boots. These boots appeared to have the best rating with a lot of customers purchasing them. She loves her new hiking boots.
customer_reviews.author: Lloyd T. Webb

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with these boots. Quality and comfort.
customer_reviews.text: I finally had the opportunity to wear these and was not disappointed. Walked down steep terrain and these boots provided great support and grip. They are very comfortable. Laces up nicely. Wore them for only a couple of hours, but was totally satisfied for that duration. Will have to wear them on longer hikes for an acid test, but quality appears very good and I have no reason to believe things will change. Price is reasonable for the quality.
customer_reviews.author: JustMyTwoCents

customer_reviews.title: These boots are made for hiking
customer_reviews.text: Best bang for my buck in quite awhile! I got these from the Warehouse, open box, and their only issue was that one of the already overlong shoelaces had been cut. These shoes are comfortable, provide great ankle and arch support, and make me feel secure when I'm hiking rugged trails. They provide moderate waterproofing, as I have stepped in streams and such with no problems. As a hiker, I totally approve, and I'm happy I got a sturdy pair of hiking boots at a fraction of what I'd expect to spend.
customer_reviews.author: Arya

customer_reviews.title: The best boots I have worn!
customer_reviews.text: I love this boot! I previously had a pair that I wore out and I was very happy to find the exact same pair to purchase. The fit was spot on and I have nothing bad to say about these boots. The price was great. They are the most comfortable boots I have owned and they are perfect for work. I wear boots to work and was having issues and pains with the boots I was wearing. Since getting my new pair, I have not had any aches, pains or issues. I plan to buy another pair just so I have them when I wear them out!
customer_reviews.author: Victoria

customer_reviews.title: I use these often
customer_reviews.text: I get usually get these shoes at Academy, so I knew my size in men's, which is what I get because of the width. They aren't the best for the inner sole, but I use inserts anyway, so. They're a price I can afford to replace every six or eight months when I'm active outdoors--they'd last longer for nonhikers. Expensive boots tend to hurt my feet and old ankle injury.
customer_reviews.author: Penn Naim

customer_reviews.title: Unfortunately when I got the boots only one of the shoes came with the extra soles
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the hiking shoes to replace my old ones that I wore to it’s death. I was very excited about them coming in. Unfortunately when I got the boots only one of the shoes came with the extra soles. Is there a way to get the other one so I can use it with both shoes?
customer_reviews.author: Quesada

customer_reviews.title: Nice boots for hiking
customer_reviews.text: My other expensive, different brand boots died a horrible death after nearly 20 yrs. I thought these would be a good replacement, and I was right. I couldn’t see spending tons of $ on boots when I’m in my 70’s. I hiked around 3 state parks over 3 weeks, and they did just fine.
customer_reviews.author: nancy carlson

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, great traction; fits slightly smaller than expected
customer_reviews.text: I bought size 9.5, which always fits me well in various shoes across the board. These boots are a little bit tight on me though with just 1 pair of athletic socks. I can't imagine wearing more than 1 pair of socks, but I haven't used these in the snow yet so maybe I would never need more than 1 pair of socks on. They have great traction and I feel very safe and confident hiking up and down very steep dirt paths. Overall they're a great purchase and I would be fine buying them again, but I would recommend going up half a size if you think you might need a little more space.
customer_reviews.author: Diedra L. Rater

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional quality for the price.
customer_reviews.text: What can I say...if I could post more stars I would...great boots!!!! Exceptional Excellent Quality...with the junk out there today, Timberland's quality through out the years never changes. I have many of there product, am happy with every purchase I make. One thing to know is that they run small...I generally, wear an 8 and always buy and 8.5 when I buy Timberland. The fit is perfect and so comfortable. And big bonus..."THEY LOOK GREAT TOO"
customer_reviews.author: Tina Panizzoli

customer_reviews.title: If you want to be the very best....
customer_reviews.text: I bought these shoes for work because I am on my feet and moving around all day. But more importantly, I have dubbed these my Pokemon Go boots. While my friends complain about their aching feet after only a few miles, I am going strong with no problems whatsoever, happily catching charmanders and hatching eggs like a true pokemon master. I've walked 28miles in 3 days and my feet don't hurt at all. The fit is great and it didn't hurt very much to break them in. I highly recommend these boots if you want to be the very best.
customer_reviews.author: SW

customer_reviews.title: Good traction
customer_reviews.text: I hike fairly rugged trails- some elevation, lots of rocks and water. These have good grip and ankle support. I am very comfortable with them. I would do five stars if the wide width were a bit wider. Narrowist 'wide' I've ever had. But I've worked them in and I love them.
customer_reviews.author: Homescholar

customer_reviews.title: Runs small
customer_reviews.text: These were too short as compared to my other 7.5 Timberlands. They were also rather stiff with not much cushion in the footbed. I like the style and slightly retro hiking boot look. Returning due to the fit.
customer_reviews.author: Cherokee2

customer_reviews.title: Run small
customer_reviews.text: They're sturdy and comfortable Great boots But they run about half a size smaller. I usually wear 7.5 and I order 8 tio have wiggle room but it was just like ordering my regular size. Also as you see in the pictures there is discoloration. I will keep them because they're for hiking but I'm just a bit disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Samikyswifey

customer_reviews.title: True to size Love them
customer_reviews.text: Love love love these boots! Super cute excellent fit !! Perfect year round ! I just can’t say enough about how much I like them the fit color everything! Good deal for timberlands! True to size I’m an 8 Fit perfect a bit stiff so a great excuse to wear them often
customer_reviews.author: mrshryan1215

customer_reviews.title: Great Hiking Boot for the Price!
customer_reviews.text: Theres boots are incredibly comfortable. They really did not need much breaking in. I treated them with a leather protectant which seems to help keep the dark brown color. I have hiked probably about 20 miles in total with them so far and they are great! Lots of arch and ankle support which was the main thing I was looking for. The tread is good too. I hiked up a pretty steep mountain with a lot of loose rock and I felt pretty good about not losing my footing!
customer_reviews.author: Kristen Malloy

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied with these boots
customer_reviews.text: Very satisfied with these boots. Have just used them once but I had no problems with blisters at all. It gave me great support on a challenging (for me) two hour hike with lots of rocks and narrow crags to maneuver around. Comfortable and sturdy from day one. I anticipate these will hold up well. Looks to be well made with quality materials. I would not hesitate in recommending them to the novice hiker who will be going over modest, but nonetheless challenging terrain.
customer_reviews.author: Mauifanfaithful

product_meta.title: Timberland Women's White Ledge Mid Ankle Boot
product_meta.description:
Uppers made with premium waterproof 100% leather from an LWG Silver-rated tannery. Seam-sealed waterproof construction. Rustproof, speed lace hardware with lace hooks at top. Padded collar and tongue for additional comfort. Fully gusseted tongue provides comfort and keeps debris out. Cushioned EVA footbed. Dual-density EVA midsole for lightweight cushioning. Rubber lug outsole for excellent traction. Single boot weight (size 9): 15.4 ounces. Imported.

Timberland set new industry standards for craftsmanship, durability and protection when it introduced an authentic, waterproof leather boot in 1973. A global leader in design, engineering and marketing of premium footwear, Timberland values consumers who cherish the outdoors and their time in it. Timberland has been an industry leader in the use of both sustainable and recycled materials in its shoes, as well as its footwear packaging. The Timberland Company believes in corporate responsibility and supports numerous civic and social projects throughout the year.
feature_bullets: You need waterproof hiking boots that can take on any trail conditions. Our White Ledge leather hikers feature shock-absorbing cushioning, rubber lug outsoles for traction and rugged outdoor-tested style.

LOOK NO FURTHER for trail-ready performance and style. Our selection of men’s hiking boots, waterproof hiking boots, casual boots, and casual shoes is designed to fit in with your outdoor-ready ensembles.
TIMBERLAND HAS YOU COVERED whether you're looking for men's boots, women's boots, or kids boots. For the best in hiking boots, rain boots, work boots, casual shoes & boots & more, choose Timberland.
WHAT YOU NEED IN THE OUTDOORS: Timberland has the gear you need for all your outdoor adventures, including jackets and coats for outdoor activities, backpacks and luggage & outdoor accessories.

THE BEST IN OUTDOORS: Trust Timberland's line of high-quality men's, women's, and kids boots. hiking boots, outdoor gear, and activewear for all your activities from the trail to the sea to the streets.
